mtSusie 0.1.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Fit multi-trait SuSiE across several regression models

    mt_susie.Rd

    Fit multi-trait SuSiE across several regression models

    mt_susie(
  X,
  Y,
  L = 5,
  W = NULL,
  clamp = 4,
  max.iter = 100,
  min.iter = 5,
  tol = 1e-08,
  coverage = 0.9,
  min.pip.cutoff = NULL,
  lodds.cutoff = 0,
  prior.var = 0.1,
  output.full.stat = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    X

    n x p design matrix

    Y

    n x m output matrix

    L

    levels or expected num of independent factors (default: 5)

    W

    n x k interaction terms matrix (default: NULL)

    clamp

    handle outliers by winsorization (default: 4)

    max.iter

    maximum iterations (default: 100)

    min.iter

    minimum iterations (default: 5)

    tol

    tolerance level check convergence (default: 1e-8)

    coverage

    targeted PIP coverage per each level (default: 0.9)

    min.pip.cutoff

    min PIP to report (default: 1/p)

    lodds.cutoff

    log-odds ratio cutoff for multi-trait factors (default: 0)

    prior.var

    prior level variance (default: 0.1)

    output.full.stat

    output every bit of the results (default: TRUE)

    Value

    a list of mtSusie estimates

    alpha

    Posterior probability of variant across p x level

    resid.var

    residual variance level x traits

    prior.var

    prior variance 1 x traits

    log.odds

    log-odds ratio level x traits

    mu

    a list of p x m mean parameters

    var

    a list of p x m variance parameters

    lbf

    a list of p x m log-Bayes Factors

    z

    a list of p x m z-scores

    n

    number of samples

    m

    number of traits/outputs

    p

    number of variants

    L

    number of layers/levels

    loglik

    log-likelihood trace

    cs

    credible sets (use data.table::setDT to assemble)

    In the cs, we have

    variants

    variant indexes [1 .. p]

    traits

    trait indexes [1 .. m]

    levels

    levels [1 .. L]

    alpha

    shared PIP

    mean

    univariate mean

    var

    univariate var

    z

    univariate z-score

    lfsr

    local false sign rate

    lodds

    log-odds ratio

    interaction

    interacting column index

    (if W!=NULL)

    Contents

    Developed by Yongjin Park.
